document_title: Gastric ulcer disease: Causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
Epigastric pain is the most common symptom of stomach ulcers
Symptoms of stomach ulcers are very diverse. Among them, the most common symptoms are a burning, gnawing feeling and pain in the abdominal area above the navel (epigastric pain). Usually, the pain will be more intense when the stomach is empty and does not contain food. Depending on the severity of the disease, the pain can last from a few minutes to several hours.
Other common signs and symptoms of the disease include:
Bloating, indigestion Nausea or vomiting Feeling full easily when eating or not wanting to eat because of pain Burping, heartburn or acid reflux Difficulty sleeping, not sleeping well Feeling tired, weak Having black or black stools blood Weight loss; Bloating, indigestion; Nausea or vomiting; Easily feeling full when eating or not wanting to eat because of pain; belching, heartburn or acid reflux; Difficulty sleeping, not sleeping well; Body fatigue and weakness; Black or bloody stools; Weight loss.
If you have any of the above symptoms, you should talk to your doctor. Symptoms may be mild at first, but if not treated promptly, they can become more severe and affect the person's life. (2)
